title: American Black feminist, activist Dorothy Pitman Hughes dies, 84
description: Hughes was a powerful American voice when feminism was seen as predominantly white and middle class

title: What’s behind antigovernment protests in Bangladesh?
description: Opposition supporters demand the prime minister's resignation and a caretaker government ahead of elections in 2023.

title: Two ISIL rebels killed in US helicopter raid in Syria: CENTCOM
description: US Central Command announces the killing less than two weeks after ISIL announced its leader was killed in battle.

title: World Cup 2022: 10 big moments so far
description: From injury time to Morocco's brilliance to Ronaldo's benching, here are the biggest stories from the tournament.

title: Saudi minister says ‘all bets off’ if Iran gets nuclear weapon
description: Prince Faisal bin Farhan Al Saud said Saudi Arabia supports efforts to revive Iran's nuclear deal as 'a starting point'.

title: Japan’s ispace launches historic first commercial moon lander
description: Privately-funded explorer carried by SpaceX rocket aims to touch down on the Atlas Crater in April.

title: How has faith given people strength in 2022?
description: The Stream is joined by an interfaith panel to reflect on the year.

title: Libyan man suspected of making Lockerbie bomb in US custody
description: Man accused of making the bomb that killed 270 people after it blew up Pan Am Flight 103 in 1988 taken into US custody.

title: ‘Unprovoked’ firing from Afghan forces kills civilians: Pakistan
description: The Pakistan army accuses Afghan forces of killing six civilians in 'indiscriminate' firing at the Chaman border.

title: At Capitol Hill, a family takes a beautiful stand
description: The Sicknick family snubbed those who failed to hold Trump accountable for the January 6 riot. They did the right thing.

title: Erdogan, Putin discuss Syria border corridor, gas hub by phone
description: Turkish president reiterated necessity for buffer zone in accordance with 2019 agreement with Russia, his office says.

title: UK: What is legitimate protest?
description: A climate organiser and an anti-arms activist discuss different tactics for change.

title: The Indian soldier who vanished on a glacier 38 years ago
description: The widow of a soldier whose body was found on Siachen Glacier this summer always hoped he would ‘come home someday’.

title: China government health adviser warns of surging COVID cases
description: Fears of a spike in infections after Beijing eased its 'zero-COVID' restrictions following rare nationwide protests.

title: Morocco’s ‘Bono’ linked to big clubs after World Cup heroics
description: The Moroccan goalkeeper has already created history, helping his nation reach the World Cup semifinals.

title: Escalating tensions after gunmen attack police in northern Kosovo
description: Animosity remains high with Serbia and Kosovo officials intensifying their exchange of words.

title: A month since Russian retreat, life in Kherson is far from normal
description: As artillery keeps battering the recently retaken Ukrainian city, officials try to clear mines left behind by Russians.

title: Kosovo postpones local election in ethnic-Serb-dominated north
description: The election was due as ethnic Serb representatives resigned to protest a ban on Serbia-issued vehicle licence plates.

title: More than 500 refugees arrive in Italy as rescue ships dock
description: Italian government sources say decision to allow ships to dock was based on poor weather and risks to those on board.

title: ‘Need time’: Southgate on his England future after World Cup loss
description: Southgate has been England's most successful coach in decade, but his side crashed out to France on Saturday.

title: Iran summons China envoy over islands dispute statement with UAE
description: Chinese envoy 'had a visit' as Tehran expressed 'strong dissatisfaction' over China's joint statement with GCC nations.

title: Russian embassy says US denied visit to Soviet graves in Alaska
description: A group of Russian diplomats prevented from visiting graves of Soviet soldiers who died in WWII, state media report.

title: Russia-Ukraine war: List of key events, day 291
description: As the Russia-Ukraine war enters its 291st day, we take a look at the main developments.

title: Neymar says ‘psychologically destroyed’ by Croatia World Cup loss
description: 'I am psychologically destroyed,' the Brazilian forward wrote on his Instagram account, which has received 18.8m likes.

title: NASA’s Orion due to splash down after historic Moon mission
description: Orion's test flight included a lunar flyby and a journey further into space than any previous habitable spacecraft.

title: German man freed more than four years after kidnapping in Niger
description: Armed men on motorcycles abducted Jorg Lange, a 63-year-old aid worker and engineer, from the town of Inates in 2018.

title: What happens to Ronaldo’s career after Portugal’s World Cup exit?
description: Morocco’s stunning upset of Portugal will likely be the 37-year-old captain's final World Cup match.

title: At Kenya’s Maasai Olympics, warriors swap lion hunt for high jump
description: The number of lions in Kenya has plummeted from about 30,000 in the 1970s to little more than 2,000 today.

title: Zelenskyy says Russia has reduced Bakhmut city to a ‘burnt ruin’
description: Ukrainian military’s General Staff reported some 20 air raids, more than 60 rocket attacks between Friday and Saturday.

title: Bangladesh opposition stages protests as it challenges PM Hasina
description: Opposition party mobilises tens of thousands of supporters in Dhaka to protest price rise and demand PM's resignation.

title: Serbia’s Vucic seeks NATO approval to send forces to north Kosovo
description: Serbian president said he was under 'no illusion' that NATO would agree to his request amid tension in northern Kosovo.
